page.title: 06CORNBURY PHEASANT SHOOT
page.content: {Pheasants }are reared to shoot in the season - 1 Oct to l Feb. Hen birds are caught in Spring to lay {eggs }to give c.{12000 chicks}. The eggs are hatched at a Game Farm, the day-old chicks are reared in calorgas brooders in Corn- bury Park to 6 wks old when they are put in {release pens} in different beats in Wychwood and released grad- ually. {Shooting starts mid-November.} They expect to shoot {2/3rds} of the birds during the season. {Shooting is {partly retained and partly let}for { {income }to fund the Game Dept. Days are let in advance at{ Â£12/13 per bird to, e.g., a {6 or 7 gun party for a {400 bird day.} Commercial and private days are not mixed. There are {6 game- {keepers}, and beaters are employed for shooting days on a casual daily basis. The bag is sold by the Estate through a game-dealer.
